question:
Which of the following were the contemporaries of Ashoka?
1. Antiochius II of Syria
2. Ptolemy II of Egypt
3. Antigonus of Macedonia
4. Magas of Cyrenaica (Libya)
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Some of the Hellenistic contemporaries of Ashoka include Antiochius II of Syria, Ptolemy II of Egypt, Antigonus of Macedonia, Magas of Cyrenaica (Libya), and Alexander of Epirus. All of these are mentioned in the edicts of emperor Ashoka.
